title: Best TTS so far!
comment: I've been using this the day I got my new Samsung Galaxy Note 4 and it has tremendously helped with my language learning instead of reading it all the time! :3  Though I do like it paired with Read Aloud, another awesome tool I have for selecting text and listening to my selection in my target learning language, I do have a few minor issues.  For some odd reason, the Notify and Read Aloud apps do not automatically detect the languages I select in Read Aloud and only goes with a default language I set. This means I have to manually set the language I want read, which is very annoying. In addition, the language detection percentage found in Read Aloud does not work at all in my heavy testing.  One other problem I have is the headset I plug in my phone used to read the audio stream I set to read aloud doesn't seem to work anymore. When I first downloaded the app a few days ago, it worked even with the head-set on. Now, it tells me "Screen On" highlighted in red as a reason why it did not speak my chosen stream.  Sometimes I need to set the device state to only "Headset On" when other people are sleeping or do not want to be disturbed and it doesn't work, period.
Nice..big help,saves time.

title: Still testing

title: Awesome!
comment: Pros: I have been looking for an app like this ever since I rooted my Gallaxy S2 back in the day and installed Cyanogenmod losing the voice notifications the Samsung built in! I ditched it in favor of a Nexus 5 when it launched. This app works really well and I love all the options! It is heading in a great direction! It is ready for daily use!  Cons: As many other reviewers have pointed out the privacy concerns of having your messages read aloud is a bit of a problem. I hope that is addressed in future updates. I like that you can have it announce the app name only but in some cases I would like to know the senders name to know if it is worth my time to open.   Possible Improvements:  Having a feature that would read only "x" amount of characters of the message could cover the privacy issue until it is possible to identify senders. It would also be nice to see varying permission for each app, for instance %t + %m / %t / %m. Also, and this is a little nit picky, it would be nice if it would announce "New email" instead of just "Email" for all messaging/email/chat style apps.

Thank you for the VERY constructive feedback! Some of those improvements such as per-app settings are planned for v1.1.0. To help keep issues and suggestions organized, improving their chances of being implemented, I would appreciate if they're posted to the GitHub issue tracker (https://github.com/pilot51/voicenotify/issues).

title: Does pretty much what I want it to, but...
comment: The app is very good overall, however it's lacking a few customisations that would take it to the next level. In particular, it would be great to be able to customise the output string on a per application basis so that I can have it say something like 'New message from [contact name]' rather than reading aloud private messages in public. Apart from the privacy concerns, it can be far too verbose. This would also negate the need to start notifications by saying the app name, as you could tell it to say 'New email from...' or '[Name] tweeted...'.  UPDATE: Unfortunately I had to uninstall it because it was causing a conflict that prevented 'Ok Google' hotword detection from working on my Nexus 5 (mic in search bar becomes hollow when VN is enabled). Will try it out again if this is fixed.

You will be happy with v1.1.0, per-app customization is the main feature planned. You may not be so happy with how long it will take for me to get around to it, but it's one of the next steps for VN. UPDATE: Hotword detection is fixed (or worked around) in source and will be in the next release.

title: Works but...
comment: Was glitchy at first, restart fixes it. Doesnt always read the full notification, or reads it to fast. Dev please add TTS voice speed control options and maybe even new voices male/female. Thanks and keep up the great work!

All TTS settings such as speed and voices are configured under the Android TTS settings and is not managed by VN. I may eventually add custom TTS settings that are separate from the system settings, but it won't make TTS itself any more configurable. You can find alternative TTS engines by searching the Play Store for "TTS engine".

title: Very Good with one exception
comment: Very good apps..  Almost perfect... except one scenario:  Vibrate/Silent is ON, I want VN to speak ONLY when handset is ON.   Bascially, I don't want VN to speak it out loud when I am in a meeting (no handset but with Vibrate/Silent ON on my phone)  Please make this scenario works!

Thank you for the feedback. If I understand correctly, you want VN to speak at all times except when silent/vibrate is on AND headset is off? Until I expand on Device States to allow that kind of logic (on to-do list), the closest you can get is to enable everything except EITHER Headset Off or Silent/Vibrate.

title: This app locks okay Google
comment: Once this app is installed the functionality for Google Now and saying OK Google is blocked and no longer works.  The minute that you turn off this app things go back to normal and okay Google starts working again.
This is a feature of Google Now to prevent accessibility apps that use TTS from inadvertently activating it. Unfortunately there is nothing I can do about it.

title: Nice app
comment: Very helpful

title: Samsung galaxy S4
comment: Nice working ,but there is a problem it will not notify me while phone is coming plz help and fix it soon.Only 4 star after fixed realy 5 star.

title: Worked for me. (Until Google updated Search)
comment: I keep my tablet on the desk next to me - closed in its cover. I have setup this App to tell me the notifying application. This is much better than a ringtone, since I can decide whether it is something worth opening the tablet for.   With the latest Google Search (Google Now) application update, Hot Word detection is broken when this App is enabled in Accessibility. Turn off VN and Hot Word detection works again).

This is a "feature" of Google Now which is evidently to prevent TTS from activating it. VN needs to be defined as a spoken feedback accessibility type in order to work. Other accessibility services that use TTS such as TalkBack have the same issue. I have not found any way around this, so unfortunately I don't think it can ever be fixed.

title: Great
comment: Been using for several months and really like it. I actually uninstalled it only to install again. Any closer to having app not disable Google hot word detection?

But theres two feature missing for 5 star, enable on Bluetooth and a different languages for SMS (all my notification are in English except my SMS which are in French, this should be a fairly common problems since android is poorly translated most of us foreign speaker will still use android in English)

Bluetooth should be working if your Bluetooth device supports A2DP. There isn't much if anything that can be done without A2DP support. Custom language and per-app customization are planned, though it will probably be some time before I get around to it.

The only thing that i would like to make this 5 star worthy app even better is to be able to customize notifications for each individual app. Definitely get this app!  update: disabling and re enabling took care of any issues i had on my phone, easy. i look forward to v1.1.0 :)

Please check the Notification Log. If notifications aren't listed, VN isn't receiving them and you may need to toggle VN or other enabled services off and on in Accessibility. If they are listed, red text indicates any reasons that VN didn't speak them. For individual app customization, that's the #1 feature planned for v1.1.0, so it's coming.

title: Work great for the most part
comment: With Voice Notify on, it crashes Opera (Not Opera Mini), I would send a crash report but that gets send to Opera, going to get an adb log of crash later

I have been emailed about this issue and concluded that it is a problem with Opera not working correctly with running accessibility services and is not specific to VN, TalkBack also causes Opera to crash. There is nothing I can do, Opera itself needs to be fixed.

title: Announcing Non Set Tasks
comment: Hi I have set Voice Notify to only work when a headset is present which works great. However when I use the internet app, it keeps saying "Page Loading" , "Page Loaded" out loud. Any fix, or something I am doing wrong?  Cheers
Be sure the 'Enhance web accessibility' option in Accessibility settings is set to 'Not allowed'. Please email me if that doesn't work.

title: got what i needed
comment: it is working great but it is not working when adding or removing headset ........now i given 4star if u fix this problem i will surely give u 5 star sooo plzzzzzzzzz fix this bug i am using android 2.3 version

If it's a Bluetooth headset, VN will not speak through the headset if it doesn't support A2DP (generally headsets older than a few years). There is nothing to my knowledge that I can do to work around it. If it supports A2DP or is a wired headset, please email me with the headset model and more detail of the issue and I'll look into it.

title: (UPDATED)Any chance
comment: Of an option to enable voice notify when Bluetooth headphones are connected and off when disconnected?   Update. My mistake. Thanks for the reply.
That option is in Device States. You want Headset On checked and Headset Off unchecked.

title: I would talk on the start screen!!! Why???
comment: Everything is so great!! I love the app! But i'm in a galaxy s3 mini and it would talk when you switch pages on the start screen "workspace 2 of 4", "workspace 3 of 4" and is going through the media output. Why?? Is there anyway to fix it??

That is apparently an issue with Light Flow and is mentioned in their known issues for Samsung phones, for which they're waiting on Samsung to fix. It looks like the only workaround until it's fixed is to not have Light Flow enabled in accessibility. Please let me know if you find any other solutions so I can better help others reporting the issue.

title: Talks when changing screen pages
comment: I am using a samsung note with os 4'1'2 and speaks when swiping pages on start screens. “page 1 of 4, page 2 of 4" etc. All apps disabled, clear cache, reinstalled. Used to be ok before Samsung update from ICS. Was ok with 422 cyanogen.  Anyway to only speak with notifications?

This is a known Android bug on certain devices and unfortunately, if the spoken messages aren't shown in the Notification Log and thus not coming from VN, there is nothing I can do with VN to fix it. Please see the issue report for possible workarounds: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=23105

title: good
comment: Good app, I use it to read stuff out when I am driving.  Bad point: it will only work if the "notification history" app I use is disabled in accessibility. It would be great to work with only certain bluetooth devices, so it won't turn on when I am connected to bt devices other than my car headset.  However, there is a workaround I use: I use tasker to freeze voice notify when I disconnect from my car headset, using shell command "pm disable com.pilot51.voicenotify".  Then when it connects, I use pm enable, then I use the "secure settings" tasker plugin to turn voice-notify's accessibility permission on and off (voice notify doesn't work for me unless I do this).  Works brilliantly now.

Update: Reset phone and reinstalled this app. It worked until SVOX TTS was installed. After that even if SVOX is uninstalled, it would still not work.  When it was working, it only announced "new email" for Gmail and didn't read the subject lines. Not very helpful.

A few things: don't hesitate to email the dev for problems rather than writing insulting comments and let's support the dev and donate for those who can. Let's help the community.

title: Great app, but messes sound routing on Honeycomb
comment: When Voice Notify is active on my Acer Iconia Tab A500 (Android 3.1 stock, 32GB), no music is played through headphones jack. Also volume buttons are redirected to adjusting notifications volume instead of media volume. Otherwise, this app is very helpful, since it reads toasts, which are displayed very briefly on my device and there's almost no chance for me to read them before they vanish. Please test Voice Notify on a Honeycomb device and fix that sound routing issue.

title: Game changing app
comment: I love this app. I no longer have to figure out what all these silly notification sounds are. This thing tells me just what I want to know.
Great, bug; when I'm listening to music trough headphones and the prog gives a voice notification...music does not restart playing. Needs Reset 2 fix
Excellent app and a must have!

I was about to write a negative comment but i read the instructions once again n i got it to work. This app is really good.
